title: HTML Tables
gp1: HTML tables allow web developers to arrange data into rows and columns.
gp2: A table in HTML consists of table cells inside rows and columns.
gp3: Each table cell is defined by a and a tag.
gp4: Everything between and are the content of the table cell.
wp1: You can have as many rows as you like in a table; just make sure that the number of cells are the same in each row.
wp2: Sometimes you want your cells to be table header cells. In those cases use the <th> tag instead of the <td> tag:
wp3: By default, the text in <th> elements are bold and centered, but you can change that with CSS.
